page.title: 16THE KINGS PATH CONT.
page.content: it was barley by the little whiskers on each piece. Soon after that we stopped for lunch. After a pleasant dinner we started to walk back. On the way back we saw the{warden of {Chippenham Fen,}and he gave us a short talk about the nature reserve. I saw a lot of flowers there, including white campions, dog roses, yellow iriss', marsh orchids, silverweed and forget-me-nots. The Kings Path is a very interesting walk and is named after{King Charles II.}This is because once or twice the King would go hare coursing down by the path. If you want to walk down the Kings Path it is best to take an adult with you. In some places you need a{permit}to walk there in case you pick any flowers or scare any birds that may be breeding, but altogether it is a very nice walk.
